content:
After posting this I found an older reply to a very similar question that had not popped up on the radar before. I was able to use this persons advice, and did a little adjusting of my own, and the problem seems to be fixed.

Thanks very much.
creator: c.evansandrews

content:
I have recently gone through this.

See Moving from old to new PC

First thing to do is to check if you are moving from 32 bit to 64 bit versions (which in my case didn't work).

I imported to the new PC from a copy of the Thunderbird directory on the old PC which has the Profile 3 levels down.
creator: hugh.gives

content: You have a custom setup, so I cannot be specific. Assuming the profile was on drive c in default location and that this is also true on new pc, I suggest you click the 'server setting' pane for each account and adjust the 'local folder pointer to wherever the account is stored.
creator: davidsk

content:
So the issue is not in Thunderbird as such if connecting another network source (your phone) resolves the issue for the duration of that connection existing.

Given that Telstra resells NBN, and only a very few of us were dumped on wireless and Satellite you will most likely have a wired connection to the internet.

So I suggest you try these things and report your results

  1. Does Thunderbird work as expected in Thunderbird troubleshooting mode?
  2. Does Thunderbird work as expected with your OS started in safe mode with Networking. Instructions for each operating system: Windows 10/11, Windows 8, Windows 7, OSX
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hi Matt. I've done the Thunderbird Trouble shooting mode and it didn't work. I also did the Windows safe mode with network restart. Unfortunately I was unable to connect to the network as the wifi wouldn't turn on. Any other suggestions?
creator: joesuen

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste di supporto:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
creator: @next

content: Welke provider gebruikt u, en hebt u de serverinstellingen al eens gecontroleerd?
creator: markh2

content: Als het uw e-mailwachtwoord is kunnen wij u niet helpen, u dient dit via uw e-mailprovider te regelen. Als het uw hoofdwachtwoord is die u in Thunderbird hebt ingesteld zie; https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/thunderbird-wachtwoorden-beschermen-hoofdwachtwoord
creator: Mad_Maks

content: To add another email account, click the 'hamburger' menu in upper right (three short stacked lines) and then click 'new account'
creator: davidsk

content: try this: highlight the inbox, rightclick, select properties, and then click repair
